alert.note: Alert for Cross (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:42AM CDT until June 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR EASTERN ST. FRANCIS...EASTERN POINSETT...SOUTHWESTERN MISSISSIPPI...CRITTENDEN...EASTERN CROSS...SOUTHWESTERN TIPTON AND WESTERN SHELBY COUNTIES... At 442 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Trumann to near Earle to Simsboro, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Marion, Trumann, Marked Tree, Earle, Harrisburg, Lepanto, Hughes, Parkin, Wilson, Tyronza, Keiser, T O Fuller State Park, Meeman Shelby Forest State Park, Memphis, Joiner, Crawfordsville, Edmondson, Dyess and Sunset. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
